alert.note: Alert for Western Kenai Peninsula (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 01 at 4:54AM AKST until February 01 at 9:00PM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 9 AM THIS MORNING TO 9 PM AKST THIS EVENING FROM NIKISKI SOUTH... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 6 inches. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Western Kenai Peninsula with the worst conditions along Cook Inlet from Nikiski south. * WHEN...From 9 AM this morning to 9 PM AKST this evening. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility to one half mile or less at times. Isolated pockets of whiteout conditions will be possible between Anchor Point and the Homer Bluffs. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow will move in through the day and increase in intensity. Winds will increase out of the NE with gusts to 35 mph. The worst conditions will likely be between 3 PM AKST and 6 PM AKST.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
